perturbation.original_text: 1.29 "Joint Venture" means the operation of the Company pursuant to this Agreement from the Effective Date to the earliest to occur of: (i) the Put Closing Date (hereinafter defined), (ii) the Call Closing Date (hereinafter defined), or (iii) termination of this Agreement pursuant to Article VII hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.29 "Joint Venture" means the operation of the Company pursuant to this Agreement from the Effective Date, but it will indefinitely continue even after (i) the Put Closing Date (hereinafter defined), (ii) the Call Closing Date (hereinafter defined), or (iii) termination of this Agreement pursuant to Article VII hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the Joint Venture's term as ending upon specific events like Put/Call options or termination. The modified text contradicts this by stating the Joint Venture continues indefinitely even after those events, creating uncertainty about the agreement's duration and obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 4.7.1 revising the budget or Business Plan of the Company;
perturbation.changed_text: 4.7.1 revising the budget or Business Plan of the Company, except for operational changes that do not exceed ¥50,000,000, which can be unilaterally approved by the AFSL-nominated director.
perturbation.explanation: Section 4.7 requires unanimous board approval for revising the budget or business plan. The added exception allows the AFSL-nominated director to unilaterally approve revisions under ¥50,000,000, directly contradicting the unanimous approval requirement and creating uncertainty about the budget revision process.

perturbation.original_text: 11.14 Governing Law; Language. The English text of this Agreement shall control any interpretation of its provisions, and this Agreement and the legal relations among the Parties and the Company shall in all respects be interpreted, construed and governed by and in accordance with the laws of Japan.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.14 Governing Law; Language. The Japanese text of this Agreement shall control any interpretation of its provisions, and this Agreement and the legal relations among the Parties and the Company shall in all respects be interpreted, construed and governed by and in accordance with the laws of Japan.
perturbation.explanation: Originally, the contract specifies that the English text takes precedence in interpretation. The modified text states the opposite, giving precedence to the Japanese text. This directly contradicts the original clause and introduces ambiguity about which language version governs the agreement's interpretation.
